segment.source: Refresh a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager (Windows 10)
segment.target: Refresh a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic will show you how to use a previously created task sequence to refresh a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager and Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2.
segment.target: This topic will show you how to use a previously created task sequence to refresh a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager and Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2.

segment.source: Refresh a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager
segment.target: Refresh a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic will show you how to use a previously created task sequence to refresh a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager and Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2.
segment.target: This topic will show you how to use a previously created task sequence to refresh a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager and Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2.

segment.source: When refreshing a machine to a later version, it appears as an upgrade to the end user, but technically it is not an in-place upgrade.
segment.target: When refreshing a machine to a later version, it appears as an upgrade to the end user, but technically it is not an in-place upgrade.

segment.source: A computer refresh also involves taking care of user data and settings from the old installation and making sure to restore those at the end of the installation.
segment.target: A computer refresh also involves taking care of user data and settings from the old installation and making sure to restore those at the end of the installation.

segment.source: For more information, see Refresh a Windows 7 computer with Windows 10.
segment.target: For more information, see Refresh a Windows 7 computer with Windows 10.

segment.source: A computer refresh with System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager works the same as it does with MDT Lite Touch installation.
segment.target: A computer refresh with System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager works the same as it does with MDT Lite Touch installation.

segment.source: Configuration Manager also uses the User State Migration Tool (USMT) from the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) 10 in the background.
segment.target: Configuration Manager also uses the User State Migration Tool (USMT) from the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) 10 in the background.

segment.source: A computer refresh with Configuration Manager involves the following steps:
segment.target: A computer refresh with Configuration Manager involves the following steps:

segment.source: Data and settings are backed up locally in a backup folder.
segment.target: Data and settings are backed up locally in a backup folder.

segment.source: The partition is wiped, except for the backup folder.
segment.target: The partition is wiped, except for the backup folder.

segment.source: The new operating system image is applied.
segment.target: The new operating system image is applied.

segment.source: Other applications are installed.
segment.target: Other applications are installed.

segment.source: Data and settings are restored.
segment.target: Data and settings are restored.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use three machines: DC01, CM01, and PC0003.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use three machines: DC01, CM01, and PC0003.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard.

segment.source: PC0003 is a machine with Windows 7 SP1, on which Windows 10 will be deployed.
segment.target: PC0003 is a machine with Windows 7 SP1, on which Windows 10 will be deployed.

segment.source: DC01, CM01, and PC003 are all members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: DC01, CM01, and PC003 are all members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: In this topic, we assume that you have a Windows 7 SP1 client named PC0003 with the Configuration Manager client installed.
segment.target: In this topic, we assume that you have a Windows 7 SP1 client named PC0003 with the Configuration Manager client installed.

segment.source: Create a device collection and add the PC0003 computer
segment.target: Create a device collection and add the PC0003 computer

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, right-click Device Collections, and then select Create Device Collection.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, right-click Device Collections, and then select Create Device Collection.

segment.source: Use the following settings:
segment.target: Use the following settings:

segment.source: General
segment.target: General

segment.source: Name: Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64
segment.target: Name: Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64

segment.source: Limited Collection: All Systems
segment.target: Limited Collection: All Systems

segment.source: Membership rules:
segment.target: Membership rules:

segment.source: Direct rule
segment.target: Direct rule

segment.source: Resource Class: System Resource
segment.target: Resource Class: System Resource

segment.source: Attribute Name: Name
segment.target: Attribute Name: Name

segment.source: Value: PC0003
segment.target: Value: PC0003

segment.source: Select Resources
segment.target: Select Resources

segment.source: Select PC0003
segment.target: Select PC0003

segment.source: Review the Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64 collection.
segment.target: Review the Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64 collection.

segment.source: Do not continue until you see the PC0003 machine in the collection.
segment.target: Do not continue until you see the PC0003 machine in the collection.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It may take a short while for the collection to refresh; you can view progress via the Colleval.log file.
segment.target: It may take a short while for the collection to refresh; you can view progress via the Colleval.log file.

segment.source: If you want to speed up the process, you can manually update membership on the Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64 collection by right-clicking the collection and selecting Update Membership.
segment.target: If you want to speed up the process, you can manually update membership on the Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64 collection by right-clicking the collection and selecting Update Membership.

segment.source: Create a new deployment
segment.target: Create a new deployment

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, select Task Sequences, right-click Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM, and then select Deploy.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, select Task Sequences, right-click Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM, and then select Deploy.

segment.source: Use the following settings:
segment.target: Use the following settings:

segment.source: General
segment.target: General

segment.source: Collection: Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64
segment.target: Collection: Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64

segment.source: Deployment Settings
segment.target: Deployment Settings

segment.source: Purpose: Available
segment.target: Purpose: Available

segment.source: Make available to the following: Configuration Manager clients, media and PXE
segment.target: Make available to the following: Configuration Manager clients, media and PXE

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It is not necessary to make the deployment available to media and Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE) for a computer refresh, but you will use the same deployment for bare-metal deployments later on and you will need it at that point.
segment.target: It is not necessary to make the deployment available to media and Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE) for a computer refresh, but you will use the same deployment for bare-metal deployments later on and you will need it at that point.

segment.source: Scheduling
segment.target: Scheduling

segment.source: default
segment.target: default

segment.source: User Experience
segment.target: User Experience

segment.source: default
segment.target: default

segment.source: Alerts
segment.target: Alerts

segment.source: default
segment.target: default

segment.source: Distribution Points
segment.target: Distribution Points

segment.source: default
segment.target: default

segment.source: Initiate a computer refresh
segment.target: Initiate a computer refresh

segment.source: Now you can start the computer refresh on PC0003.
segment.target: Now you can start the computer refresh on PC0003.

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, in the Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64 collection, right-click PC0003 and select Client Notification / Download Computer Policy.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, in the Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64 collection, right-click PC0003 and select Client Notification / Download Computer Policy.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The Client Notification feature is new in Configuration Manager.
segment.target: The Client Notification feature is new in Configuration Manager.

segment.source: On PC0003, using the Software Center (begin using the Start screen, or click the New software is available balloon in the system tray), select the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM deployment and click INSTALL.
segment.target: On PC0003, using the Software Center (begin using the Start screen, or click the New software is available balloon in the system tray), select the Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM deployment and click INSTALL.

segment.source: In the Software Center warning dialog box, click INSTALL OPERATING SYSTEM.
segment.target: In the Software Center warning dialog box, click INSTALL OPERATING SYSTEM.
